DataElement.preferredName: Emission Scan Post Radioactivity Stop Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Clock time in minutes when the emission scan ended following the injection of radiotracer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements._Put an end to a state or an activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Concepts.definition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.:Put an end to a state or an activity.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.
Put an end to a state or an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/8/13 created per Round 4 community review comment. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/30/17 jk transferred context; added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 8/29/13 curated for the CFR Standardization work. tt
